sentences.english: She get left her key in the office or get to toce the gate open.
sentences.chinese: 她把鑰匙忘在了辦公室，只好強行把門打開。

sentences.english: When I was doing the housework, my husband telephoned me from the office.
sentences.chinese: 當我正在幹家務時，我丈夫從辦公室打電話給我。

sentences.english: He doesn't get along with anybody in the office.
sentences.chinese: 他和辦公室任何人都處不來。

sentences.english: because it sounds like he spends every waking moment at the office.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這聽起來他每一刻都在辦公室工作。

sentences.english: I'm tired of being cooped up in this office.
sentences.chinese: 我厭倦了被關在這辦公室裏。

sentences.english: Fig1. Paper is staple food supposing office is restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 如果辦公室是個餐館，紙應該是每天消耗最多的主食。

sentences.english: Think twice about the office watercooler.
sentences.chinese: 在辦公室使用冷卻器請三思。

sentences.english: Allison, Jack and I wanna see you in his office.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉森，來下辦公室，我和傑克找你。

sentences.english: Is the office near public transport, either the subway or a bus station?
sentences.chinese: 新辦公室離公共交通工具，地鐵或者公共汽車站近嗎？

sentences.english: The two dueled, transforming the office of politics into an arena of lightsaber combat.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆展開決鬥，把政府辦公室變成光劍格鬥場。

sentences.english: I had to go below ground to an office where I spoke to a policeman.
sentences.chinese: 我走到了地下的一間辦公室才和一個警察說上話。

sentences.english: I ----- Tom ------- ------ Miss Li's office just now.
sentences.chinese: 我剛纔看到湯姆走進了李老師的辦公室。

sentences.english: There are some _ offices on the third floor.
sentences.chinese: 四樓有幾間空着的辦公室。

sentences.english: When I am about to nod off in the office, the boss walked in.
sentences.chinese: 我在辦公室剛剛欲睡，老闆走了進來。

sentences.english: Standing there in the office, miserable, I wanted to vanish into the paneling.
sentences.chinese: 我傷心地站在辦公室門口，恨不得消失在門縫裏。

sentences.english: He sometimes stays at the office alone when he's on a case.
sentences.chinese: 一忙起來，他就經常獨自一人待在辦公室。

definition: Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
at the helm of state/political power/regime

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
earthern goblet stand also known as 垿[xu4] (old)
Yanzi (-c 500 BC), famous statesman from Qi of the Warring States, also known as 晏子, hero of book 晏子春秋
Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Wei of the Northern Dynasties 386-534
account books/registers/records
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
King Zhuang of Chu (reigned 613-591 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
temple/ancestral shrine
deceased father/deceased senior male figure
law and order
Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Haojing (in modern Shaanxi, northwest of Chang'an county), capital of Western Zhou from c. 1050 BC
